docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Scraped Content from NanoTech NYC
docs.text: This documentation also includes content scraped from the NanoTech NYC website for reference purposes.

docs.title: Available Scraped Content
docs.text:
The following pages have been scraped and are available in the scraped/ directory:

  • Browse the content by navigating to individual files
  • All content is sourced from nanotechnyc.com
  • Content includes research posts, activity pages, and more

docs.title: About NanoTech NYC
docs.text: NanoTech NYC is focused on nanotechnology research and development in New York City. This content was scraped for documentation and reference purposes.

docs.title: Code examples
Code Blocks in Content Tabs
Flowcharts
docs.text:
graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Failure?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Investigate...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Success!];

docs.title: Sequence Diagrams
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  Server->>Terminal: Send request
  loop Health
      Terminal->>Terminal: Check for health
  end
  Note right of Terminal: System online
  Terminal-->>Server: Everything is OK
  Terminal->>Database: Request customer data
  Database-->>Terminal: Customer data
